quotes.quote: Color is my day-long obsession, joy and torment.
Color in certain places has the great value of making the outlines and structural planes seem more energetic.
All the other colors are just colors, but purple seems to have a soul — when you look at it, it's looking back at you.
Mere color, unspoiled by meaning, and unallied with definite form, can speak to the soul in a thousand different ways.
Color should be used to depict the three major emotions in a man's life—anticipation, realization and retrospection.
Color is only beautiful when it means something.
Color does not add a pleasant quality to design - it reinforces it.
Coloring outside the lines is a fine art.
Colors are the smiles of nature.
I think the names of colors are at the edge, between where language fails and where it's at its most powerful.
Each color lives by its mysterious life.
All colours will agree in the dark.
A dominant colour possesses tremendous power in making a painting unique.
Color... thinks by itself, independently of the object it clothes.
Colour is a creative element, not a trimming.
Color is an intense experience on its own.
Colors express the main psychic functions of man.
Good colour really means good taste; and 'powerful' colour means a reserve, to give a climax its full force, and not 'red, white, and blue all over.
It almost always happens that true, but exaggerated, coloring is more agreeable than absolute coloring.
Colour is, on the evidence of language alone, very bound up with the feelings.
Colour is as variable and evanescent in the form of pigment as in visible nature.
Color is the language of the poets. It is astonishingly lovely. To speak it is a privilege.
Colors speak all languages.
Colours are brighter when the mind is open.
A color is as strong as the impression it creates.
Color is the fruit of life.
Color, rather than shape, is more closely related to emotion.
Color is a matter of taste and of sensitivity.
Not only can color, which is under fixed laws, be taught like music, but it is easier to learn than drawing, whose elaborate principles cannot be taught.
Color is born of the interpenetration of light and dark.

Color is an act of God that neither confers privileges nor imposes a handicap. A man's skin is like the day: day is neither clear or dark. There is nothing more to it until external agencies come in and invest it with special meaning and importance.
To demand that color in color films should be 'natural' is to misunderstand all that is involved.
Directors want color that is an emphasis factor, the way color is in life, and to catch the poetry of the essential gray in life.
Color is basically immobile, and yet it must move. Color is wrong for a film that tries to be as subjective as mine...the only way to use color is subjectively.
The color was a character of its own.
The landscape was bleak and bereft of color...like a painting in grisaille with its many tints of gray.
In our life, there is a single color, as on an artist's palette, which provides the meaning of life and art. It is the color of love.
Color is visually musical, being both rythic and lyrical. It sets the tempo of a design through the blending of a multitude of hues.
Like beautiful melodies and poignant words, color draws from the deep emotions within us.
Each color has its own beauty and individuality, which you may accept or reject.
In art, color is used as a visual language. It is the communication link between creator and viewer.
In the grand scheme of nature, blue is a major player in the background of our world, but is rarely exhibited in the living landscape.
Color is life: for a world without colors appears to us as dead.
Colors are the children of the light, and light is their mother.
Color effects are in the eye of the beholder.
Color is a power which directly influences the soul.
I am a believer that color affects people's moods.
I found I could say things with color and shapes that I couldn't say any other way
The best color in the whole world is the one that looks good on you
Life is a train of moods like a string of beads and as we pass through them they prove to be many-colored lenses which paint the world their own hue, and each shows only what lies in its focus
The purest and most thoughtful minds are those which love color the most.
I don't fancy colors of the face, I'm always attracted to colors of the brain.
Let me, O let me bathe my soul in colours; let me swallow the sunset and drink the rainbow.
Life is a sea of vibrant color. Jump in.
People are like M&Ms. They come in a variety of colors, they're hard on the outside, and full of obscene yumminess on the inside.
She knew then that white was more than a color: It was a cold, pale shade of understanding that seems to take all of your hope away.
Colours are nature gone wild.
Sunrise paints the sky with pinks and the sunset with peaches. Cool to warm. So is the progression from childhood to old age.
Whatever you choose for your stationery is your favorite color because it's where you pour your heart out.
Red was ruby, green was fluorescent, yellow was simply incandescent. Color was life. Color was everything. Color, you see, was the universal sign of magic.
